creator: a_cogito@yahoo.fr
text:
I open a new one since it has nothing to do anymore with Bug: 29580 ...

using jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1_src.zip from scrath, I get compilation error:
compile-http:
    [mkdir] Created dir: C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-src\jakarta-jmeter-
2.0.1_src\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1\build\protocol\http
    [javac] Compiling 72 source files to C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-src\jakarta-
jmeter-2.0.1_src\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1\build\protocol\http
    [javac] C:\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1-src\jakarta-jmeter-2.0.1_src\jakarta-jmeter-
2.0.1
\src\protocol\http\org\apache\jmeter\protocol\http\sampler\HTTPSamplerBase.java:
105: illegal forward reference
    [javac]             pattern= new Perl5Compiler().compile(
    [javac]             ^
    [javac] 1 error
--
java version "1.4.0_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0_01-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.0_01-b03, mixed mode)

creator: a_cogito@yahoo.fr

text:
Created attachment 11864
patch to compile JMeter 2.0.1 src with jsdk 1.4.0 (compilation with ant is ok)
creator: a_cogito@yahoo.fr
a_cogito@yahoo.fr
text:
Changing to :
java version "1.4.2_04"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_04-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_04-b05, mixed mode)

src don't need the patch, compilation is ok.

It's a change of behavior in jsdk1.4.2
(but I didn't find any information about this here: 
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/ReleaseNotes.html ?!)

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Trivial change, so I updated the code anyway.
[Also made the field private.]
